intro: Boesenbergia kerrii, commonly known as the red ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features sword-shaped leaves and produces vibrant red or orange inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a spicy, aromatic scent. Boesenbergia kerrii is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
